individual_metadata.synopsis: The party comes across a trio of goblins who've captured a gnome and have turned to tormenting him - they've tied him to a windmill and are watching him spin around. The party can try to intervene and save the gnome, possibly using a cult symbol of authority as a way to convince the goblins, if they have it. FOR_GnomeGoblin_1 (Fezzerk) is the leader of the goblins and does most of the talking. If the player is a drow, the goblins will be much more nervous and easier to intimidate. At times, the captive goblin pipes up from the windmill, loudly pleading or berating his captors.
individual_metadata.how_to_trigger: Repro steps:1. Start the game2. loadlevel WLD-Main_A3. goto 27.47, 34.27, 419.294. Advance towards the windmill5. Cinematic should trigger automaticaly

AD_UnfortunateGnomeGone.synopsis: The goblins are leaving after witnessing their captive gnome get launched from the blade of a windmill at high speed. Now that their amusement's been catapulted away, they have no reason to linger.

StatusFallback.synopsis: The party comes across a trio of goblins who've captured a gnome and have turned to tormenting him - they've tied him to an windmill and are watching him spin around. Here, the player approaches while using wildshape (they're in animal form, so the scene unfolds in a shortened manner that quickly turns to combat).
StatusFallback.how_to_trigger: Repro steps:1. Start the game with a druid and level up (Ctrl-shift-L on the character)2. loadlevel WLD_Main_A3. Debug BookGoto region > Act 1 > Forest > Abandoned Village4. Kill combat5. Head towards the windmill up the stairs.6. Morph into any wildshape.7. Talk to Fezzerk (Goblin with great axe)

Dead.synopsis: A speak with dead dialogue with a slain goblin, Fezzerk. As he's been just temporarily resurrrected from the afterlife, he speaks in slow, cryptic, fragmented phrases. From him, the player can gain a little insight into their hostage-taking activities. If Fezzerk recognises the player as his killer, he won't speak at all.

Surrender_NotAtWindmill.synopsis: After being defeated in combat, a goblin named Fezzerk begs for mercy from the player. He tries to bargain for his life. The player can let him go or kill him. This dialogue takes place somewhere away from the windmill where Fezzerk was tormenting Barcus Wroot.

AD_InvestigateMill.synopsis: Some goblins tormenting a gnome tied to a windmill are surprised when it stops rotating.

automatic_ordering.reasoning: The initial scene (the session with an empty name) sets up the encounter where the party finds goblins tormenting a gnome at the windmill. From that session two branching outcomes can occur: one branch leads to the gnome being launched from the windmill, which then triggers the session AD_UnfortunateGnomeGone, and another branch occurs when the party or the goblins react to the windmill suddenly stopping, triggering AD_InvestigateMill. In addition, there is an alternate way of triggering the initial encounter: if the player’s character is in wildshape the scene is handled by the StatusFallback session. Since the player cannot experience both the standard and the wildshape variant of the encounter at the same time, these two are mutually exclusive. Finally, when interacting with Fezzerk in combat, there are two different outcomes. In one branch, after combat the goblin pleads for mercy (Surrender_NotAtWindmill), whereas in the alternative branch the player kills him and later accesses a speak-with-dead dialogue (Dead), making those two sessions exclusive outcomes.

2.speaker: Fezzerk
2.context: CinematicNodeContext: The lead goblin's face falls mid-sentence when he realises he's being confronted by a drow.NodeContext: The goblin loses his bluster mid sentence upon realising he's facing a feared drow

26.speaker: Barcus Wroot
26.context: CinematicNodeContext: A captive deep gnome swings past on the sail of a spinning windmill. Though he's in peril, this is basically being played as a comedic beat.NodeContext: Distressed. The deep gnome is tied to the sail of a windmill and desperately calls for help as he rotates. He's a short-moderate distance away and has to shout to be heard.

18.speaker: Barcus Wroot
18.context:
CinematicNodeContext: A captive deep gnome wriggles on the sail of a (stationary) windmill. Though he's in peril, this is basically being played as a comedic beat.
NodeContext: Distressed. The deep gnome is tied to the sail of a windmill and desperately calls for help. He's a short-moderate distance away and has to shout to be heard.

89.speaker: Narrator
89.text: *The goblin seems unsure whether to bow to you or attack.*

71.speaker: Fezzerk
71.text: W-what do you want, or, I mean... what do you need?
71.context: NodeContext: Nervous, fumbling over his words. He's naturally afraid of drows such as the player.

84.speaker: Player
84.text: An explanation - tell me what you're doing with that deep gnome, at once.

268.speaker: Fezzerk
268.context: NodeContext: Fezzerk trails off, realising that he might be revealing too much to the player.

53.speaker: Fezzerk
53.text: You... you are blessed, ain't ya? A True Soul?
53.context: NodeContext: Warily seeking confirmation that the player is a superior of his, and not some random stranger.

39.speaker: Narrator
39.text: *The mark glows, but you feel nothing in response. Your illithid power is beyond reach until you rest.*

204.speaker: Player
204.text: Of course I'm a True Soul. How dare you even question the fact?

284.speaker: Fezzerk
284.text: N-no, not questionin', True Soul! Never! We know our place...

75.speaker: Fezzerk
75.text: ...It's, erm, it's back at our camp. The boss will be expectin' us.

116.speaker: Player
116.text: Cease your babbling - what did you mean?

153.speaker: Fezzerk
153.context: CinematicNodeContext: The lead goblin's nervous expression slips away as he realises he was mistaken about the player's allegiance. NodeContext: Fezzerk's subservience trickles away as he realises that the drow player is not in fact a superior of his in the cult.

148.speaker: Fezzerk
148.text: If you ain't with the Absolute, you're the enemy.

189.speaker: Player
189.text: I don't answer to the likes of you.

137.speaker: Fezzerk
137.text: Erm, p-pardon. Didn't mean to doubt you. I know my place.

9.speaker: Fezzerk
9.text: W-well, that's that... We'll be on our way. Do as you like with the pipsqueak...
9.context: NodeContext: Intimidated by the player, and trying to make his excuses to slip away as soon as possible.

279.speaker: Fezzerk
279.text: Naw... something ain't right. You're not like the others...
279.context: CinematicNodeContext: The lead goblin's demeanour changes from nervousness to suspicion.NodeContext: Fezzerk fear of the drow player slips away, replaced by suspicion.

207.speaker: Player
207.text: Naturally - do I look cursed to you?

15.speaker: Player
15.text: Say nothing. Stare down the gibbering coward.

202.speaker: Player
202.text: Did I say you could ask questions?

64.speaker: Player
64.text: I am the fear-dream of disloyal whelps. You are starting to irk me. Leave.

37.speaker: Player
37.text: I am a True Soul. Your prisoner is now mine.

129.speaker: Fezzerk
129.context: NodeContext: A little distant and dazed. He's just been psychically interferred with by the player, so that he does as they say.

88.speaker: Narrator
88.text: *A shiver runs across your mind... You feel sated.*

280.speaker: Fezzerk
280.text: We'll, eh... we'll be on our way, True Soul. Do as you like with the pipsqueak...
280.context: NodeContext: Faraway and subservient after being psychically dominated by the player.

130.speaker: Narrator
130.text: *The goblins slink backwards, afraid to take their eyes off you.*

55.speaker: Player
55.text: Wait - I haven't dismissed you. Continue the show.

140.speaker: Fezzerk
140.text: Erm... n-not much to it: pull a lever an' enjoy the squeals.

173.speaker: Fezzerk
173.text: We gotta dash. Goblin business... erm, very important.

43.speaker: Fezzerk
43.text: Erm... ask the pipsqueak on the spinny tower - we're out of here!

266.speaker: Fezzerk
266.text: C'mon, you lot, hop it before they change their mind!

219.speaker: Narrator
219.text: *Something stirs deep within you, hungry and alert... it's taking something you'll never get back.*

127.speaker: Narrator
127.text: *Your mind lurches, reeling suddenly as if... bitten.*

102.speaker: Narrator
102.text: *A shadow swims across your vision, and a familiar voice tells you to be calm. You are loved.*

107.speaker: Narrator
107.text: *Your blood runs quicker, feeding the gnawing absence at the centre of your mind.*

223.speaker: Narrator
223.text: *The presence deep in your mind is awake, unblinking. This is it. A single word pervades your consciousness: 'Soon'.*

188.speaker: Narrator
188.text: *Your mind is full, bursting with ecstasy and terror. Finally, it is coming. You are becoming.*

201.speaker: Player
201.text: I am a True Soul. Your prisoner is now mine.

19.speaker: Player
19.text: Show them your brand and tell them to carry on.

76.speaker: Fezzerk
76.text: Erm... well, y'see... I just remembered... our boss - he's the same as you.
76.context: NodeContext: Intimidated by the player, and trying to make his excuses to slip away as soon as possible.

120.speaker: Fezzerk
120.text: And, erm, he wants us back at our camp. Right now.

54.speaker: Narrator
54.text: *A strange symbol glows, marked on their flesh, and something within you stirs in response.*

40.speaker: Narrator
40.text: *As the symbol glows, power courses through you. Authority.*

5.speaker: Player
5.text: Leave, immediately. This prisoner is mine now.

269.speaker: Fezzerk
269.text: Y-you want that little pipsqueak...? But we're supposed to take 'im hostage...
269.context: NodeContext: Caught between deferential and wary.The drow player could be his superior, or an outside threat.

274.speaker: Fezzerk
274.text: ...but you know that, of course... erm... don't you?
274.context: NodeContext: Warily seeking confirmation that the player is a superior of his, and not some random stranger.

278.speaker: Player
278.text: Did I tell you to stop? Turn around and continue as you were.

239.speaker: Fezzerk
239.context: NodeContext: Fezzerk is surprised and still wary of the drow player's intentions.

259.speaker: Fezzerk
259.text: K-keep him spinning! Make that birdie chirp!
259.context: NodeContext: Fezzerk continues to taunt the captive gnome, but is now nervous and self-conscious due to the observing drow player. It's like his boss is breathing down his neck.

183.speaker: Fezzerk
183.text: G-get that birdie spinning again! Make him chirp for us!
183.context: NodeContext: Fezzerk continues to taunt the captive gnome, but is now nervous and self-conscious due to the observing drow player. It's like his boss is breathing down his neck.

35.speaker: Barcus Wroot
35.context: CinematicNodeContext: The gnome rotates on a windmill sail helplessly. He's in peril, but this is basically a comedic beat.NodeContext: Projecting. The gnome is tied to the sail of a windmill and desperately calls for help as he swings around.

246.speaker: Fezzerk
246.text: Erm... not that I'm complainin'... but you are blessed, ain't ya?
246.context: NodeContext: Warily seeking confirmation that the player is a superior of his, and not some random stranger.

7.speaker: Fezzerk
7.text: High time we got out of here.

158.speaker: Fezzerk
158.text: Look what we got here - another little birdie wantin' to fly!
158.context: CinematicNodeContext: Cinematic/look-at context - Fezzerk notices us and calls out to his cronies. (The line is addressed to the goblin raider and scavenger, but Fezzerk's attention is broadly held by the player.NodeContext: Cruel bravado.The goblin sees the player approach and boldly announces it to his cronies - he thinks some fresh victims have just turned up.

277.speaker: Fezzerk
277.text: Yehehueh! Flap those wings some more, an' I'll feed you a worm!
277.context:
CinematicNodeContext: Cinematic/look-at context - Fezzerk calls out to taunt his deep gnome prisoner, who rotates on the sail of a windmill a short-moderate distance off.NodeContext: Greatly amused. A schoolyard bully tormenting the little kid. Projecting his voice a little (Fezzerk calls out to taunt his deep gnome prisoner, who rotates on the sail of a windmill a short-moderate distance off.)
'Yehehueh!' = Fezzerk's distinct laugh (a raspy, mean-spirited slur of a laugh)

33.speaker: Fezzerk
33.text: Yehehueh! Enjoyin' yerself? Sun ain't too bright in those beady little eyes?
33.context:
CinematicNodeContext: Cinematic/look-at context - Fezzerk calls out to taunt his deep gnome prisoner, who rotates on the sail of a windmill a short-moderate distance off.NodeContext: Greatly amused. A schoolyard bully. Projecting his voice a little (Fezzerk calls out to taunt his deep gnome prisoner, who rotates on the sail of a windmill a short-moderate distance off.)
'Yehehueh!' = Fezzerk's distinct laugh (a raspy, mean-spirited slur of a laugh)

113.speaker: Fezzerk
113.text: An' you - hope you got a stomach fer heights!
113.context: CinematicNodeContext: The goblin turns back to the player (if the gnome inclusion line triggered - otherwise he's facing the player the whole time.)NodeContext: Confident, unpleasant. Turning his attention to the player to deliver a threat.

90.speaker: Player
90.text: What the hells are you doing?

272.speaker: Fezzerk
272.text: What's it bloody look like? We're teaching this 'ere pipsqueak to fly!
272.context: NodeContext: Proud (Referring to the captive gnome's he's tied to the rotating sail of a windmill)(

8.speaker: Player
8.text: Let me rephrase that - why are you doing this?

263.speaker: Fezzerk
263.context: NodeContext: Mirthsome. He loves himself some sport at the expense of others.

200.speaker: Player
200.text: I'm not looking for trouble - just want to pass by.

60.speaker: Player
60.text: I won't interfere. I just want to pass by.

136.speaker: Fezzerk
136.text: Heh, funny. That's what our birdie wanted.
136.context: NodeContext: Mocking. Refers to the player's previous statement ('I don't want trouble - just want to pass by').

22.speaker: Barcus Wroot
22.context: CinematicNodeContext: Context - the deep gnome yells at his captors as he swings into earshotNodeContext: Panicked, angry. Issuing an ultimatum even though he has no means of following through on it.

254.speaker: Fezzerk
254.text: 'Less you wanna join him up there, you'd best pay the toll.
254.context: CinematicNodeContext: The lead goblin looks at his hands and tries to calculate a figure with his fingers.NodeContext: Fezzerk mockingly refers to the deep gnome's predicament as he threatens the player. 'Passing by' refers to rotating on a windmill rather than safe passage through the area, in his book.

141.speaker: Fezzerk
141.text: 'Less you wanna join him up there, you'd best pay the toll.
141.context: CinematicNodeContext: The lead goblin looks at his hands and tries to calculate a figure with his fingers.NodeContext: Confident, threatening. Thinks he holds all the cards in a one-sided negotiation.

108.speaker: Fezzerk
108.context: InternalNodeContext: The idea is the goblin is a bit dim greedy and throwing out a stupidly high number.NodeContext: Fezzerk declares his price. (A ridiculously high sum - questionable whether he truly knows how absurd a demand this is)

51.speaker: Narrator
51.text: *The mark glows, but you feel nothing in response. Your illithid power is beyond reach until you rest.*

249.speaker: Player
249.text: Your price is absurd and you know it.

98.speaker: Fezzerk
98.text: Oofh! That's a... a big bloody sack o' gold. Neheuhuerh...
98.context: CinematicNodeContext: Fezzerk reacts to receiving a heavy sum of gold.NodeContext: Happy disbelief. Fezzerk is gobsmacked by the weight of gold, then starts laughing in disbelief. He's just gotten a lot more than he anticipated.

182.speaker: Fezzerk
182.text: Y'know what? Fair's fair. On yer way, an' take the runt, too. We've got gold to count...
182.context: NodeContext: Chuckling in amazement. Almost friendly. He's just struck the jackpot and has completely lost interest in the proceedings at hand.

264.speaker: Fezzerk
264.text: Y'know what? Fair's fair. Enjoy the show. C'mon, you lot, leave the runt. Let's go.
264.context: CinematicNodeContext: |Context - the goblins leave, content to take gold over their captive|NodeContext: Chuckling in amazement. Almost friendly. He's just struck the jackpot and has completely lost interest in the proceedings at hand.

36.speaker: Player
36.text: I can pay twice that much. I just have to go and fetch it.

11.speaker: Fezzerk
11.text: A haggler, are ya? How 'bout this: you live...
11.context: CinematicNodeContext: *The goblin counted out on his grimy fingers once again.*NodeContext: A dimwit bully who thinks he's shrewd operator.

226.speaker: Fezzerk
226.context:
NodeContext: Mocking. Delighted with himself. Thinks he's really blindsided the player (in reality, he's demanded a far smaller sum than the first figure he's asked of the player).
'Yehehueh!' = Fezzerk's distinct laugh (a raspy, mean-spirited slur of a laugh)

276.speaker: Player
276.text: Here's my counter-offer: you can all live so long as you leave right now.

240.speaker: Player

216.speaker: Fezzerk
216.text: You wanna haggle? Fine. The price has just doubled!
216.context: NodeContext: Displeased. He wasn't expecting negotiations to actually involve negotiating.

152.speaker: Fezzerk
152.context: NodeContext: Mocking. Delighted with himself. Thinks he's really blindsided the player (in reality, he's demanded a far smaller sum than the first figure he's asked of the player).

14.speaker: Player
14.text: Pay the 'higher' sum to the goblin.

111.speaker: Fezzerk
111.context: CinematicNodeContext: Fezzerk, the lead goblin, receives a sum of gold from the player.NodeContext: Content. Thinks he's made a fine deal and is now willing to let the player off the hook.

248.speaker: Fezzerk
248.text: If I see you here again, no price will save you.

261.speaker: Player

198.speaker: Player

275.speaker: Fezzerk

275.context: NodeContext: Deeply offended. Completely oblivious to his mathematical failings.

238.speaker: Fezzerk
238.text: I'll count how long it takes you to bleed out unless you pay!

234.speaker: Player
234.text: I've changed my mind - release the gnome and clear off. Or else.

205.speaker: Fezzerk
205.text: Or else what, you'll fight us? Bit late to find some backbone, don't you reckon?
205.context: NodeContext: Unwavering. The player has decided to stand up for themselves after intially being deferential, but Fezzerk is having none of it.

82.speaker: Fezzerk
82.text: We're gettin' gold from you even if we 'ave to take the fillings from your teeth!
82.context: NodeContext: Anger boils over as his demands fall flat. Violence is imminent.

220.speaker: Player
220.text: I am a True Soul. I will pay nothing, and you will leave.

83.speaker: Player
83.text: I'm going to pay nothing, and you and your cronies are going to leave.

66.speaker: Fezzerk
66.text: Y-you're a True Soul... I didn't know. Wouldn't dare question you, never!

212.speaker: Narrator
212.text: *A shiver runs across your mind... You feel sated.*

178.text: *Something stirs deep within you, hungry and alert... it's taking something you'll never get back.*

38.speaker: Narrator
38.text: *A shadow swims across your vision, and a familiar voice tells you to be calm. You are loved.*

10.speaker: Narrator
10.text: *Your blood runs quicker, feeding the gnawing absence at the centre of your mind.*

242.speaker: Fezzerk
242.text: We'll, erm, we'll leave you to it.

256.speaker: Narrator
256.text: *The presence deep in your mind is awake, unblinking. This is it. A single word pervades your consciousness: 'Soon'.*

78.speaker: Narrator
78.text: *Your mind is full, bursting with ecstasy and terror. Finally, it is coming. You are becoming.*

103.speaker: Fezzerk
103.context: NodeContext: Angry, about to fight. Player just tried to mindmeld the goblin (but failed).

48.speaker: Fezzerk
48.text: You picked the wrong time to be cheap...
48.context: InternalNodeContext: The player previously chose more peaceful options in dealing with the goblins. Now they'll get one more chance to grovel and avoid combat.

143.speaker: Player
143.text: Wait! Just let me go... please.

86.speaker: Fezzerk
86.text: Bah, now you've gone and spoiled the fun. I like it better when they've got some fight in 'em.
86.context: NodeContext: Disdainful. It's not as much fun for him now that the player's outright grovelling,

104.speaker: Fezzerk
104.text: Clear off and don't come back. Tell your mummy how the nasty goblins made you wet your britches.

232.speaker: Fezzerk
232.text: Ugh. That whinging of yours hurts my ears. A cut throat'll quieten you good and proper.

4.speaker: Player
4.text: Haggle with the goblin, though you lack even a modest sum of gold.

73.speaker: Player
73.text: Here's my counter-offer: a far more reasonable sum. ([GEN_CheckMagicPocketGold_3_01f129ea-b4dc-44b6-8154-9a948f876a82])

69.speaker: Player
69.text: That's a ridiculous amount. I'll make you a realistic offer. ([GEN_CheckMagicPocketGold_4_5dac5eea-faeb-459c-b675-46c51519b784])

50.speaker: Fezzerk
50.text: That's a lot of coin. I think.
50.context: NodeContext: Uncertain. The goblin's internal thoughts, being 'eavesdropped' on by the player.

186.speaker: Fezzerk
186.text: What the... I felt that! You were in my noggin like a worm in an apple!
186.context: NodeContext: Alarm and outrage. Realised the player was reading his mind.

74.speaker: Fezzerk
74.context: CinematicNodeContext: Fezzerk (lead goblin) gestures to the other two to attack, while still keeping his attention primarily on the player.NodeContext: Fezzer's had enough talking - he shouts at his goblin companions to attack the player(s)

176.speaker: Player
176.text: This will lead only to pain, not fulfilment.

114.speaker: Fezzerk
114.text: Eh? I ain't after fulfilment! I'm after the fillin' of my pockets. Now yer gonna pay more!
114.context: NodeContext: Doesn't quite comprehend the player's meaning ('I clenched my fist. This would lead them only to pain, not fulfillment') He just wants his ransom.

128.speaker: Player
128.text: Provide directions to a non-existent cache of gold.

44.speaker: Fezzerk
44.text: I might just look into that... after I'm through squeezin' some gold outta you right now.
44.context: CinematicNodeContext: *The goblin counted out on his grimy fingers once again.*NodeContext: Doesn't fall for the player's gambit -  'I rattled off directions to a non-existent cache of gold. All theirs'

181.speaker: Player
181.text: Not an orator, eh? I could teach you how to talk gold out of any purse, for free passage.

222.speaker: Fezzerk
222.text: I don't want lessons, I want gold. But I'll settle for cuttin' out that silver tongue of yours...
222.context: CinematicNodeContext: *The goblin counted out on his grimy fingers once again.*NodeContext: Offended. The player tried to explain his own business to him and he isn't having any of it (a fight breaks out right afterwards)

236.speaker: Player
236.text: I think I'll just kill you for free instead.

125.speaker: Player
125.text: I'm not going to haggle. Leave now, and I'll let you live.

41.speaker: Player
41.text: I'm not haggling with you. Stand down or die.

28.speaker: Fezzerk
28.text: Oh, that's how it is, is it...?
28.context: NodeContext: In this moment, he's deciding he's going to have to kill the player.

250.speaker: Wyll
250.text: Be careful! Let's get this poor man down alive.

126.speaker: Narrator
126.text: *A strange symbol glows, marked on their flesh, and something within you stirs in response.*

142.speaker: Narrator
142.text: *As the symbol glows, power courses through you. Authority.*

230.speaker: Fezzerk
230.text: Heh, funny. That's what our birdie wanted.
230.context: CinematicNodeContext: |Cinematic context - the gnome wriggle helplessly on the windmill sail|NodeContext: Mocking.

166.speaker: Player
166.text: It does look funny, I'll admit. Mind if I stay and watch a while?

262.speaker: Fezzerk
262.text: We ain't lookin' fer company, maggot - not unless you wanna join 'im up there...

177.speaker: Fezzerk
177.text: Heh... How 'bout this: you pay a toll, an' go on as you like... or else you fly!

156.speaker: Player
156.text: Fun's over - release the gnome at once.

199.speaker: Fezzerk
199.text: You want this little cave-lurkin' wotsit?

67.speaker: Fezzerk
67.context: CinematicNodeContext: Context - the goblin reaches for his weapon.

172.speaker: Narrator
172.text: *The mark glows, but you feel nothing in response. Your illithid power is beyond reach until you rest.*

265.speaker: Player
265.text: You don't have the stomach for a fight.

258.speaker: Player
258.text: We're allies - I have the Absolute's brand. Leave the gnome to me.

31.speaker: Player
31.text: We're allies, you and I. Servants of the Absolute.

225.speaker: Fezzerk
225.text: You? One of us? Not bloody likely!

133.speaker: Player
133.text: I won't let you harm a defenceless being - not without a fight.

16.speaker: Narrator
16.text: *The goblin's nostrils flare, as if trying to judge you through smell alone...*
16.context: CinematicNodeContext: He swallows nervously, and lowers his blade if drawn. His companions follow suit.NodeContext: Narration

282.speaker: Fezzerk
282.text: All right, fine! Take the little blood clot. Good riddance to the lot o' ye!

96.speaker: Fezzerk
96.context: NodeContext: Stiff. A lame attempt at saving face. Ordering his cronies to retreat, contrary to his earlier confidence.

138.speaker: Goblin Devout
138.text: What about the gnome? Ain't we s'posed to bring him to -
138.context: NodeContext: Confused. His superior's just contradicted their standing orders.

68.speaker: Fezzerk
68.context: NodeContext: Angry (at the subordinate who questioned him) but also nervous - he wants to leave while he has a chance.

210.speaker: Fezzerk
210.text: There's plenty of sport an' rich pickings out there fer us. Move it!
210.context: NodeContext: Unconvincing attempt to save face. He's just bottled it and is retreating/

21.speaker: Fezzerk
21.text: Apologies, your grace. We didn't mean to doubt a True Soul. We'll be off.

122.speaker: Fezzerk
122.text: The runt's ours. You should've taken a wide path around us.
122.context: CinematicNodeContext: The goblin scowls and draw his scimitar/brandishes it if already drawn.NodeContext: Unwavering. He won't be won over by any powers of persuasion on the player's part.

123.speaker: Fezzerk
123.text: We ain't going no place! And y'know what? Neither are you...
123.context: NodeContext: Fed up of negotiations. Time to just kill this nosey parker.

285.speaker: Player
285.text: Negotiations are over. Either leave or die.

134.speaker: Player
134.text: I'm not bargaining with you. Free him, or I swear on my oath, you will die.

174.speaker: Player
174.text: All of you lot against one deep gnome? You should go find a better target.

72.speaker: Player
72.text: You've had your fun - it's high time you found someone else to torment.

42.speaker: Fezzerk
42.text: Hurrh... I reckon we could do better than this runt, aye...
42.context: NodeContext: There's bigger fish in the lake, he wonders out loud.

211.speaker: Narrator
211.text: *The goblin's nostrils flare, as if trying to judge you through smell alone...*

27.speaker: Fezzerk
27.context: NodeContext: An aggressive sneer. Fezzerk isn't won over by the player's suggestion that he find someone else to pick on - throwing their remark back at them.

61.speaker: Fezzerk
61.text: Y'hear that? This one wants us to bugger off so he can poach our prize!
61.context: CinematicNodeContext: The lead goblin glances back to his cronies, mocking the player's failed efforts to negotiate with them.NodeContext: Mean bravado. Fezzerk calls out to his cronies, mocking the player's attempt to reason with him,

180.speaker: Player
180.text: Don't utter a word. Just stare down the goblin.

194.speaker: Player
194.text: I consider the gnome under my protection. You don't want to fight me for him.

218.speaker: Fezzerk
218.text: I ain't got much stomach for a fight. Better just put on a show an' scare this one off.
218.context: NodeContext: The goblin's internal thoughts, which the player is 'eavesdropping' on. Worried. Scheming.

80.speaker: Player
80.text: Show him your brand and say you're taking the gnome. The Absolute wills it.

30.speaker: Fezzerk
30.text: Well... all right, take 'im. But he still counts as my catch, not yours!
30.context: NodeContext: Fezzerk pronounced 'Fez-irk'. Previous bluster deflates rapidly. Fezzerk is shocked to realise that the player appears to be his ally, and quickly adopts a less confrontational tone.

224.speaker: Player
224.text: Your skull will make a fine chalice once I plug those beady eye sockets.

221.speaker: Fezzerk
221.text: Nawh... you wouldn't be able, you're just a... erm...
221.context: NodeContext: Fezzerk tries to keep face, but his confidence rapidly crumbles as he digests the player's threat ('I smiled. His skull would make a fine chalice, once I cleaned it out')

106.speaker: Player
106.text: You're making a mistake. You can think it over in the Fugue Plane.

247.speaker: Fezzerk
247.context: NodeContext: Momentarily confused. He doesn't realise the nature of the threat just level at him.

167.speaker: Fezzerk
167.context: NodeContext: Bravado gone. Sudden realisation that he's threatened the wrong person.

197.speaker: Narrator
197.text: *A strange symbol glows, marked on their flesh, and something within you stirs in response.*

1.speaker: Player
1.text: You will release the gnome. That's an order.

184.speaker: Fezzerk
184.context: NodeContext: A little dazed and distant. Though he doesn't know it, the goblin has just been psychically dominated into following the player's command.

29.speaker: Narrator
29.text: *A shiver runs across your mind... You feel sated.*

23.speaker: Narrator
23.text: *The goblin's nostrils flare nervously. All of his bluster seems to vanish.*

49.speaker: Narrator
49.text: *Something stirs deep within you, hungry and alert... it's taking something you'll never get back.*

109.speaker: Narrator
109.text: *Your mind lurches, reeling suddenly as if... bitten.*

32.speaker: Narrator
32.text: *A shadow swims across your vision, and a familiar voice tells you to be calm. You are loved.*

208.speaker: Narrator
208.text: *Your blood runs quicker, feeding the gnawing absence at the centre of your mind.*

165.speaker: Narrator
165.text: *The presence deep in your mind is awake, unblinking. This is it. A single word pervades your consciousness: 'Soon'.*

168.speaker: Narrator
168.text: *Your mind is full, bursting with ecstasy and terror. Finally, it is coming. You are becoming.*

145.speaker: Player
145.text: I am a True Soul. Now, once again - release the gnome.

159.speaker: Player
159.text: I am a True Soul. Now once again - release the gnome.

99.speaker: Player
99.text: You will release the gnome. That's an order.

121.speaker: Fezzerk
121.text: No! Get out of my head!

270.speaker: Narrator
270.text: *As the symbol glows, power courses through you. Authority.*

119.speaker: Fezzerk
119.text: Find your own! He's ours an' we ain't sharin'!
119.context: CinematicNodeContext: Context - the goblin reaches for his weapon, but the player also notices an extra detail - the brand of the Absolute on the goblin's skin

164.speaker: Fezzerk
164.text: Back again? I gave my last bloody warning already. You've got a death wish, I reckon...
164.context: NodeContext: Enough talk. He gave the player fair warning - now they fight.

AD_UnfortunateGnomeGone_0.speaker: Fezzerk
AD_UnfortunateGnomeGone_0.text: Look's like the fun's over. C'mon, let's see who else we can snatch.
AD_UnfortunateGnomeGone_0.context: NodeContext: Calling to his assembled goblin cronies - 'c'mon fellas, let's wrap it up here.'

StatusFallback_1.speaker: Fezzerk
StatusFallback_1.text: What's this? Local wildlife havin' a gawk?
StatusFallback_1.context: CinematicNodeContext: NOTE: Camera should avoid showing the player as they could be in an unknown wildshape form here. Cinematic/look-at context - Fezzerk notices us and calls out to his cronies. (The line is addressed to the goblin raider and scavenger, but Fezzerk's attention is broadly held by the player (in wildshape animal form)InternalNodeContext: NOTE: Camera should avoid showing the player as they could be in an unknown wildshape form here.NodeContext: Cruel bravado + some surprise. Reacting to the player approaching while in animal form.

StatusFallback_0.speaker: Fezzerk
StatusFallback_0.text: Kill it - that thing'll roast up nicely for our supper.
StatusFallback_0.context: CinematicNodeContext: Waving on his fellow goblins to attack the player.InternalNodeContext: NOTE: Camera should avoid showing the player as they could be in an unknown wildshape form here.NodeContext: Urging his cronies to attack the player.

Dead_6.speaker: Narrator
Dead_6.text: *The corpse does not stir. It will answer no more questions.*

Dead_13.speaker: Fezzerk
Dead_13.context: NodeContext: A cryptic, fragmented croak, spoken by a temporarily-resurrected corpse.

Dead_1.speaker: Fezzerk
Dead_1.text: Fezzerk... best raider... east o' the... Sea o' Swords...
Dead_1.context: NodeContext: A cryptic, fragmented croak, spoken by a temporarily-resurrected corpse.

Dead_0.speaker: Player
Dead_0.text: What were you doing in the village?

Dead_7.speaker: Fezzerk
Dead_7.context: NodeContext: A cryptic, fragmented croak, spoken by a temporarily-resurrected corpse.

Dead_16.speaker: Fezzerk
Dead_16.context: NodeContext: A cryptic, fragmented croak, spoken by a temporarily-resurrected corpse.

Dead_17.speaker: Fezzerk
Dead_17.context: NodeContext: A cryptic, fragmented croak, spoken by a temporarily-resurrected corpse.

Dead_23.speaker: Fezzerk
Dead_23.context: NodeContext: A cryptic, fragmented croak, spoken by a temporarily-resurrected corpse.

Dead_20.speaker: Fezzerk
Dead_20.context: NodeContext: A cryptic, fragmented croak, spoken by a temporarily-resurrected corpse.

Dead_2.speaker: Player
Dead_2.text: Are there others like you nearby?

Dead_5.speaker: Fezzerk
Dead_5.text: Many... so many... legions o' goblins... an' more... serving... the Absolute...
Dead_5.context: NodeContext: A cryptic, fragmented croak, spoken by a temporarily-resurrected corpse.

Dead_22.speaker: Narrator
Dead_22.text: *The spell's power wanes. You can ask no more questions.*

Dead_26.speaker: Narrator
Dead_26.text: *The corpse seems willing to speak - but not to its killer.*

Surrender_NotAtWindmill_7.speaker: Fezzerk
Surrender_NotAtWindmill_7.text: You sure I c-can't just leave?
Surrender_NotAtWindmill_7.context: NodeContext: Scared, bargaining for this life.

Surrender_NotAtWindmill_25.speaker: Fezzerk
Surrender_NotAtWindmill_25.text: Stop! I give up! M-mercy, please!
Surrender_NotAtWindmill_25.context: NodeContext: Desperate, grovelling. He's throwing in the towel as he's on the verge of losing a fight.

Surrender_NotAtWindmill_5.speaker: Narrator
Surrender_NotAtWindmill_5.text: *The goblin's snivelling makes your blood boil. You could give in to the rage and end the wicked little maggot in one strike...*
Surrender_NotAtWindmill_5.context: CinematicNodeContext: Barbarian player glowers murderously at Fezzerk

Surrender_NotAtWindmill_12.speaker: Narrator
Surrender_NotAtWindmill_12.text: *...but perhaps he knows something useful? Your head aches as rage fights against reason.*
Surrender_NotAtWindmill_12.context: CinematicNodeContext: Barbarian player glowers murderously at Fezzerk

Surrender_NotAtWindmill_29.speaker: Player
Surrender_NotAtWindmill_29.text: Ignore the rage. Listen to your head. There is nothing to gain from being rash.

Surrender_NotAtWindmill_2.speaker: Narrator
Surrender_NotAtWindmill_2.text: *The veil of rage wavers. Your blood seems to cool in your veins.*
Surrender_NotAtWindmill_2.context: CinematicNodeContext: Barbarian's expression softens as they overcome their battle rage.

Surrender_NotAtWindmill_16.speaker: Fezzerk
Surrender_NotAtWindmill_16.context: NodeContext: Nervous, afraid for his life.

Surrender_NotAtWindmill_32.speaker: Narrator
Surrender_NotAtWindmill_32.text: *It's no use. Your body seems to have a mind of its own as you move to strike the goblin dead.*
Surrender_NotAtWindmill_32.context: CinematicNodeContext: Barbarian's glowering gets more intense as they move to strike fezzerk

Surrender_NotAtWindmill_14.speaker: Player
Surrender_NotAtWindmill_14.text: Leave reason to the reasonable. Kill the runt.

Surrender_NotAtWindmill_31.speaker: Fezzerk
Surrender_NotAtWindmill_31.text: I know things. If you let me live, I'll make it worth your while. I p-promise!
Surrender_NotAtWindmill_31.context: InternalNodeContext: Non-barbarian flowNodeContext: Scared, bargaining for this life.

Surrender_NotAtWindmill_23.speaker: Player
Surrender_NotAtWindmill_23.text: I want the gold you took. Now.

Surrender_NotAtWindmill_8.speaker: Fezzerk
Surrender_NotAtWindmill_8.text: A-all right, fine. Take it - take it all! Now... can I go...?
Surrender_NotAtWindmill_8.context: CinematicNodeContext: Fezzerk hands over whatever gold the player previously gave him. Can occur out of frame/inventory transfer.NodeContext: Desperate. He'll say yes to anything in order to save his hide.

Surrender_NotAtWindmill_19.speaker: Fezzerk
Surrender_NotAtWindmill_19.text: A-all right, fine. Take it - take... Wait. It's... it's gone!
Surrender_NotAtWindmill_19.context: CinematicNodeContext: Fezzerk hands over whatever gold the player previously gave him. Can occur out of frame/inventory transfer.NodeContext: Desperate.Realises that the gold he was going to bargain for his life is missing.

Surrender_NotAtWindmill_21.speaker: Player
Surrender_NotAtWindmill_21.text: Give me my gold back - and anything else you have, too.

Surrender_NotAtWindmill_22.speaker: Player
Surrender_NotAtWindmill_22.text: Talk and you might live. If it's worth my while.

Surrender_NotAtWindmill_24.speaker: Fezzerk
Surrender_NotAtWindmill_24.text: M-my lot are camped nearby - I can get you inside, no hassle! You can loot it, do whatever!
Surrender_NotAtWindmill_24.context: NodeContext: Nervous. Spilling the beans. His life likely depends on whether the player finds this info useful.

Surrender_NotAtWindmill_9.speaker: Fezzerk
Surrender_NotAtWindmill_9.text: There's a hidden path, p-past the bridge into the camp. Over to the side before you reach the first guards. Easy.
Surrender_NotAtWindmill_9.context: NodeContext: Nervous. Spilling the beans. His life likely depends on whether the player finds this info useful.

Surrender_NotAtWindmill_33.speaker: Player
Surrender_NotAtWindmill_33.text: Run along, goblin. Before I change my mind.

Surrender_NotAtWindmill_15.speaker: Fezzerk
Surrender_NotAtWindmill_15.context: NodeContext: Surprise. He's being left off the hook. He stammers out an acknowledgement before making a swift exit.

Surrender_NotAtWindmill_6.speaker: Player
Surrender_NotAtWindmill_6.text: I want everything of value you have.

Surrender_NotAtWindmill_27.speaker: Player
Surrender_NotAtWindmill_27.text: Your valuables are mine now. Hand them over.

Surrender_NotAtWindmill_3.speaker: Fezzerk
Surrender_NotAtWindmill_3.context: NodeContext: A final desperate cry (he's killed by the player immediately after this).

AD_InvestigateMill_0.speaker: Fezzerk
AD_InvestigateMill_0.text: Why's the spinnymajigger stopped? Get it moving again!
AD_InvestigateMill_0.context: NodeContext: Impatient and suspicious.The windmill that the goblins are using to torment their captive has stopped - their leader wants his cronies to investigate and get the windmill working again.

AD_InvestigateMill_1.speaker: Fezzerk
AD_InvestigateMill_1.text: Our birdy flew away! Go check 'round back!
AD_InvestigateMill_1.context: NodeContext: Surprised and suspicious.The windmill that the goblins are using to torment their captive accelerated and launched the gnome through the air.
